Incorporate PLDoc 1.3.3 changes - support "AT LOCAL" and "AT TIME ZONE (DBTIMEZONE|SESSIONTIMEZONE|literal|expression)" time zone clauses
Support directory command line parameter (-d) in Settings command-line parser
Use Settings.outputDirectory value when writing output file in PLDocCPDTask

Cut and Paste PLDoc Settings.java, etc. in order to generate a version of CPD (Cut and Paste detector- ironic eh?) that can run against source stored in databases.
